intro.description:
This cheat sheet will demonstrate how to import, modify and test the Eclipse Browser plug-in.
To learn more about using cheat sheets, click the help button in the top right corner (?).

item.title: Open the Plug-in Development perspective
item.description:
To open the plug-in development perspective, select Window->Open Perspective->Other... and choose Plug-in Development.
Alternatively, click the following button to perform the task:

item.title: Import the Eclipse Browser plug-in
item.description: To import the sample plug-in for this tutorial, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select "File->Import..." from the main menu to bring up the Import wizard. Expand the "Plug-in Development" category, and choose "Plug-ins and Fragments". Press "Next".
Select the "Projects with source folders" radio button in the "Import As" section towards the bottom of the page. Press "Next".
Select the "org.eclipse.browser" plug-in in the "Plug-ins and Fragments found" table. Click the "Add-->" button to move it to the table on the right . Press "Finish".

item.title: Open the plug-in manifest editor
item.description:
Expand the org.eclipse.browser project in the Package Explorer view and double-click on the plugin.xml file.
Alternatively, click the following button to perform the task:

item.title: Define a view extension
item.description: To define a view extension, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: On the "Extensions" page of the plug-in manifest editor, press the "Add..." button to open the "New Extension" wizard.
Select "org.eclipse.ui.views" from the "Extension Points" list box and press "Finish".
Right-click on the "org.eclipse.ui.views" node and select "New->view" from the context menu.
Replace the content of the "id" text box under "Extension Element Details" with "org.eclipse.browser.view".
Replace the content of the "name" text box with "Eclipse Browser".
Replace the content of the "class" text box with "org.eclipse.browser.view.ui.EclipseBrowserView".
Replace the content of the "icon" text box with "icons/eclipse_icon.gif".

item.title: Test the plug-in
item.description: To test your plug-in, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: On the "Overview" page of the plug-in manifest editor, click the "Launch an Eclipse application" hyperlink under the "Testing" heading to launch a second instance of Eclipse.
In the second Eclipse instance, dismiss the Intro by clicking on the "Go to Workbench" image. Select "Window->Show View->Other..." from the top level menu.
Under the "Other" category, select the "Eclipse Browser" view and press OK. This will open the Eclipse Browser view at the bottom right.
Drag the Eclipse Browser view and stack it over the Outline view on the left of the workbench window.
Explore the various sections of the view depicting the structure of the Eclipse Project. Double-click on links and nodes to open the associated web pages in an embedded browser.
Select "File->Exit" from the main menu to close the second Eclipse instance.
